title: Fenix2000
author: Fenix2000
content: Does anyone know how to find the Richlist for past years? I don't want the current richlist just from other years and I remember doing this in the past.TIA

comments.author: Catenaccio
comments.body: Quote from: Fenix2000 on December 12, 2023, 01:27:10 AMDoes anyone know how to find the Richlist for past years? I don't want the current richlist just from other years and I remember doing this in the past.All time rich list that is not what you want https://bitinfocharts.com/top-100-richest-bitcoin-addresses.htmlAddresses Holding > X BTC by Year (maybe not what you wanted)https://www.lookintobitcoin.com/charts/addresses-holding-x-btc-by-year/Customized rich list for new rich addresses appear in 2021, 2022, 2023.https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/outputs?s=value(desc)&q=time(2021-01-01..2021-12-31)#f=time,value,recipienthttps://blockchair.com/bitcoin/outputs?s=value(desc)&q=time(2022-01-01..2022-12-31)#f=time,value,recipienthttps://blockchair.com/bitcoin/outputs?s=value(desc)&q=time(2023-01-01..2023-12-12)#f=time,value,recipient

comments.author: YUriy1991
comments.body: What is your actual purpose in looking for this data? would you make an article about them. If it's true, that's good, but you have to remember that all data only displays the ownership address, for identical data it may be anonymous and besides that, you can search for it in several popular data analysis tools including CipherTrace, Chainalysis, and CoinMetrics and data from Catenaccio can be used as a reference too.

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: Quote from: Fenix2000 on December 12, 2023, 01:27:10 AM<â€¦>The Bitcoin Rich List has currently got 566 historical snapshots stored in the WayBackMachine. You may not find the data for an exact date, but roughly every month since 2017 has got a stored snapshot, with a few dating back further.Bear in mind that, once you're on a given snapshot, moving around using page links or any sort of link may change the date of the snapshot being presented. In other words, if you start clicking things, you need to look at the date of the snapshot on the top right hand side of the page, to check if it has moved you from one snapshot to another.

comments.author: 2Pizza410000BTC
comments.body: Quote from: Fenix2000 on December 12, 2023, 01:27:10 AMDoes anyone know how to find the Richlist for past years? I don't want the current richlist just from other years and I remember doing this in the past.TIAOf course it is possible to find last year's rich list if you hold bitcoins. There are also a few altcoins that can make you rich in 2024 if you hold them. We know Bitcoin will be halved in 2024. A Bitcoin halving in 2024 will surely make Bitcoin worth $100,000 or more. I think those who can hold Bitcoin will be rich in the coming years. And there are hundreds of proofs that many people have gotten rich in the past years by keeping this Bitcoin away. I would never recommend buying coins other than Bitcoin because Bitcoin is a safe investment with low risk.

comments.author: odunybiz
comments.body: Quote from: YUriy1991 on December 12, 2023, 04:05:42 AMWhat is your actual purpose in looking for this data? would you make an article about them. If it's true, that's good, but you have to remember that all data only displays the ownership address, for identical data it may be anonymous and besides that, you can search for it in several popular data analysis tools including CipherTrace, Chainalysis, and CoinMetrics and data from Catenaccio can be used as a reference too.I know for sure OP will have a very unique purpose why he/she is demanding for this data. But if the purpose for it is so unquie that other can learn from it, it will be good if OP can write an article about it for other in the forum to learn.

comments.author: Kelward
comments.body: Quote from: odunybiz on December 12, 2023, 11:59:42 PMQuote from: YUriy1991 on December 12, 2023, 04:05:42 AMWhat is your actual purpose in looking for this data? would you make an article about them. If it's true, that's good, but you have to remember that all data only displays the ownership address, for identical data it may be anonymous and besides that, you can search for it in several popular data analysis tools including CipherTrace, Chainalysis, and CoinMetrics and data from Catenaccio can be used as a reference too.I know for sure OP will have a very unique purpose why he/she is demanding for this data. But if the purpose for it is so unquie that other can learn from it, it will be good if OP can write an article about it for other in the forum to learn.I'm with you on this, because it'll be good if OP has a unique reason for requesting Bitcoin, rich list, except for showing the fact that we have supper rich investors in Bitcoin, I don't see any meaningful reason to have the list. The list does not have any impact in the supply and demand of Bitcoin, because the identify of the wallet owners are concealed. Anyways I'm glad that he's able to get what he wants, and let it be useful for him, he perhaps wants to keep the list as a motivation for him to aspire to be like them.
